wpml_active_languages.name: wpml_active_languages
wpml_active_languages.summary: Get a list of the languages enabled for a site
wpml_active_languages.description:
Filters the list of the languages enabled (active) for a site. This filter is usually used to create custom language switchers.

This filter can only work when the global $wp_query object has been instantiated. This means that it should be called after the wp action happens.

WPML returns a site’s active (enabled) languages as an array with relative information per language. For example, for a WordPress site running English, French and Italian, the hook will return this:

Array( [en] => Array  (   [id] => 1   [active] => 1   [native_name] => English   [missing] => 0   [translated_name] => English   [language_code] => en   [country_flag_url] => http://yourdomain/wpmlpath/res/flags/en.png   [url] => http://yourdomain/about  ) [fr] => Array  (   [id] => 4   [active] => 0   [native_name] => Français   [missing] => 0   [translated_name] => French   [language_code] => fr   [country_flag_url] => http://yourdomain/wpmlpath/res/flags/fr.png   [url] => http://yourdomain/fr/a-propos  ) [it] => Array  (   [id] => 27   [active] => 0   [native_name] => Italiano   [missing] => 0   [translated_name] => Italian   [language_code] => it   [country_flag_url] => http://yourdomain/wpmlpath/res/flags/it.png   [url] => http://yourdomain/it/circa  ))

The wpml_active_languages filter provides a way to do things like reorder the language array. Or something more complex, like redirecting missing languages to a custom url.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

args.label: args
args.description: (array|string) (Optional) Arguments to filter the language outputskip_missing(bool) How to treat languages with no translations. 1 to skip language or 0 to link to home of language for missing translations.link_empty_to(string) Works in conjunction with skip_missing = 0 and allows using custom links for the languages that do not have translations for the current element. {%lang} can be used as placeholder for the language code. Empty by default.orderby(string) Accepts id|code|name Defaults to custom. The custom order can be defined in the WordPress admin under WPML » Languages » Language Switcher Optionsorder(string) Accepts asc|desc

wpml_browser_redirect_language_params.name: wpml_browser_redirect_language_params
wpml_browser_redirect_language_params.summary: Filters the $params argument which is an associative array that contains information about the current language
wpml_browser_redirect_language_params.description:
This filter can be used when the theme developer wants to use a different cookie name or tweak the languageUrls array to use different URLs.

It uses the $params argument which is an associative array containing some information about the current language, the active languages and the cookie settings.

languageUrls.label: languageUrls
languageUrls.description: Stores an associative array containing all the current page’s translation URLs. The keys of the array are the language codes. The same language can have multiple entries to match a different combination of language codes. For instance, in the case of en_US, the same URL is repeated three times with the following keys: en_us, en, and us.

cookie.label: cookie
cookie.description: Stores an associative array with the cookie settings. Please refer to Document.cookie for more details. The keys are:name: the name of the cookie (defaults to _icl_visitor_lang_js).domain: the domain in which the cookie must be used (defaults to the current domain and is not meant to be changed).path: the path of the cookie (defaults to /).expiration: the expiration in seconds is read from the value set in Remember visitors’ language preference that can be found in Browser language redirect on the WPML -> Languages.

wpml_cross_domain_language_data.name: wpml_cross_domain_language_data
wpml_cross_domain_language_data.description:
• Pass the necessary information among language domains. You can find more details in our document Passing session data between languages in domains.
  • This is specific for the language URL format Different languages in directories.
  • To get back the data, use the filter wpml_get_cross_domain_language_data.

function_to_add.label: function_to_add
function_to_add.description: (callable) (Required) Your callback to be run when the filter is applied.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

wpml_decode_string.name: wpml_decode_string
wpml_decode_string.summary: Decode fields that are in a format that WPML does not understand
wpml_decode_string.description: Custom fields can be encoded in a format that WPML does not understand. Those fields have to be decoded and encoded before WPML can translate them. To achieve this, the wpml_decode_custom_field and wpml_encode_custom_field filters must be used. These filters can be used if there is additional custom encoding besides the ones already handled by WPML.

custom_field_val.label: custom_field_val
custom_field_val.description: Value contained within field that needs to be decoded

custom_field_name.label: custom_field_name
custom_field_name.description: Name of the field that needs to be decoded

wpml_default_language.name: wpml_default_language
wpml_default_language.summary: Get the default language enabled for a site

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL.  This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

wpml_display_language_names.name: wpml_display_language_names
wpml_display_language_names.summary: Get a language's native and translated name for display in a custom language switcher
wpml_display_language_names.description:
Checks if the native name of a language and the translated name of the same language are different. If so, it returns them both. Otherwise, it returns only one.
This filter is usually used in custom language switchers.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

translated_name.label: translated_name
translated_name.description: (string|bool) (Required) The language translated name Defaults to FALSE

lang_native_hidden.label: lang_native_hidden
lang_native_hidden.description: (bool) (Optional) Default is FALSE 0|false or 1|true Whether to hide the language native name or not

lang_translated_hidden.label: lang_translated_hidden
lang_translated_hidden.description: (bool) (Optional) Default is FALSE 0|false or 1|true Whether to hide the language translated name or not

wpml_duplicate_generic_string.name: wpml_duplicate_generic_string
wpml_duplicate_generic_string.summary: Filter post data upon duplication before saving
wpml_duplicate_generic_string.description: WPML applies this hook filter on custom field values, post content, post title and post excerpt when a WordPress post type is being duplicated and before the data is saved into the database. The data are in this way made available to external themes and plugins for filtering.

meta_data.label: meta_data
meta_data.description: (array) (Optional) See details below:context(string) The data context. Set to “custom_field” if the value belongs to a custom field and “post” for all other cases (post title, content or excerpt)attribute(string) Set to: “value” for custom fields, “content” for post content, “title” for post title, “excerpt” for post excerptkey(string) The $post_meta->meta_key if the filter is being applied to custom field values. Otherwise the id of the original post that acts as master for duplication$is_serialized(bool) Passed only for custom field data. true|false Whether the data is serialized. This allows to unserialize the value if needed.post_id(int) Passed only for custom field data. The id of the post being duplicatedmaster_post_id(int) Passed only for custom field data. The id of the original post that acts as master for duplication

wpml_editor_cf_to_display.name: wpml_editor_cf_to_display
wpml_editor_cf_to_display.summary: Filter custom fields displayed in WPML's translation editor
wpml_editor_cf_to_display.description:
WPML applies this hook filter on custom field values when a post is displayed in translation editor. The custom field value is in this way made available to external themes and plugins for filtering.

Note: This hook requires the WPML Translation Management module

element.label: element
element.description: (object) (Optional) The element object available for filtering

job.label: job
job.description: (object) (Optional) The job object the $element belongs to

wpml_element_has_translations.name: wpml_element_has_translations
wpml_element_has_translations.summary: Find out whether a post type or a taxonomy term is translated
wpml_element_has_translations.description: Returns TRUE or FALSE based on whether a post type or taxonomy term is translated or not.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

element_id.label: element_id
element_id.description: (int) (Required) The element id to retrieve the information of. Use term_id for taxonomy terms, post_id for post types

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Required) The type of element the ID belongs to. Can be a post type: post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key} or taxonomy: category, post_tag, nav_menu {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_element_language_code.name: wpml_element_language_code
wpml_element_language_code.summary: Get the language code for a translatable element
wpml_element_language_code.description:
This filter hook will retrieve the language code for a translatable element by querying WPML’s icl_translations database table.

Also look at wpml_element_language_details if you are interested in more information such as the element’s trid

language_code.label: language_code
language_code.description: (string) (Required) A 2-letter language code. Defaults to null.

args.label: args
args.description: (array) (Required) An array of arguments to be used.element_id(bool) Use term_taxonomy_id for taxonomies, post_id for postselement_type(string) The type of element to check. Can be a post type: post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key} or taxonomy: category, post_tag, nav_menu {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_element_language_details.name: wpml_element_language_details
wpml_element_language_details.summary: Get the trid, language code and source language code for a translatable element
wpml_element_language_details.description:
This filter hook will retrieve language information for a translatable element. It queries WPML’s icl_translations database table and returns an object with the element’s trid, source language code and language code.

If you are only looking for the element’s language code you might prefer to use wpml_element_language_code

element_object.label: element_object
element_object.description: (object) (Required) A WordPress object. Defaults to null.

args.label: args
args.description: (array) (Required) An array of arguments to be used.element_id(bool) Use term_taxonomy_id for taxonomies, post_id for postselement_type(string) The type of element to check. Can be a post type: post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key} or taxonomy: category, post_tag, nav_menu {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_element_link.name: wpml_element_link
wpml_element_link.summary: Get the url for a post type or taxonomy term for the current language
wpml_element_link.description:
Returns a post type link or taxonomy term link in the current language.

* Note: There are alternative ways to retrieve an element’s link which gives developers fuller control over the HTML output.
WordPress offers a number of functions to do this such as get_permalink(), get_term_link(), etc.

If you plan on using functions that require a post type or term ID as a parameter then you may be interested in looking into the wpml_object_id filter.

element_id.label: element_id
element_id.description: (int) (Required) The ID of the post type (post, page, attachment, custom post) or taxonomy term (tag, category, custom taxonomy) to link to

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Optional) The type of element to link to. Can be ‘post’, ‘page’, ‘attachment’, ‘{custom post}’, ‘tag’, ‘category’, ‘{custom taxonomy}’. Defaults to ‘post’

link_text.label: link_text
link_text.description: (string) (Optional) The link text. Defaults to the element’s name

echo.label: echo
echo.description: (bool) (Optional) 0|false to return or 1|true to echo the localized link. Defaults to true

return_original_if_missing.label: return_original_if_missing
return_original_if_missing.description: (bool) (Optional) If set to true it will always return a value (the original value, if translation is missing). Default is TRUE

wpml_element_translation_type.name: wpml_element_translation_type
wpml_element_translation_type.summary: Find out whether a post type or taxonomy term has been translated or duplicated
wpml_element_translation_type.description: Returns a post type or taxonomy term’s translation type (translated or not | duplicated or is a duplicate itself).

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

element_id.label: element_id
element_id.description: (int) (Required) The element id to retrieve the information of. Use term_id for taxonomy terms, post_id for post types

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Required) The type of element the ID belongs to. Can be a post type: post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key} or taxonomy: category, post_tag, nav_menu {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_element_trid.name: wpml_element_trid
wpml_element_trid.summary: Get “trid” (the ID of the translation group) of a translated element
wpml_element_trid.description:
• Get trid (the ID of the translation group) of a translated element, which is required for the  wpml_get_element_translations filter and others which expect this argument.
  • Learn more about trid on the WPML’s tables documentation page.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is usually the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This is needed for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list.

element_id.label: element_id
element_id.description: (integer) (Required) The ID of the item (post_id for post types, term_taxonomy_id for taxonomy terms).

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Optional) The type of an element. Can be a post type: post_post, post_page, post_attachment, post_nav_menu_item, post_{custom post key} or taxonomy: tax_category, tax_post_tag, tax_nav_menu, tax_{custom taxonomy key}. Defaults to post_post if not set.

wpml_element_type.name: wpml_element_type
wpml_element_type.summary: Get the WPML element type name for a post type or taxonomy term as saved in the database
wpml_element_type.description: Filters a WordPress element type (post type, taxonomy term, comment) by adding the WPML prefix ‘post_’, ‘tax_’ (for default tags use ‘post_tag’), or nothing for ‘comment’ as used in the icl_translations db table.

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Required) Accepts comment, post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key}, nav_menu, category, post_tag, {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_elements_without_translations.name: wpml_elements_without_translations
wpml_elements_without_translations.description: This filter hook can be used to retrieve elements without translations

element_ids.label: element_ids
element_ids.description: (array) (Required) An array of element ids. Defaults to an empty array.

args.label: args
args.description: (array) (Required) An array of arguments to be used.target_language(bool) The target language code. A 2-letter codesource_language(bool) The source language code. A 2-letter codeelement_type(string) The type of element to check. Can be a post type: post, page, attachment, nav_menu_item, {custom post key} or taxonomy: category, post_tag, nav_menu {custom taxonomy key}

wpml_encode_string.name: wpml_encode_string
wpml_encode_string.summary: Encode fields that are in a format that WPML does not understand
wpml_encode_string.description: Custom fields can be encoded in a format that WPML does not understand. Those fields have to be decoded and encoded before WPML can translate them. To achieve this, the wpml_decode_custom_field and wpml_encode_custom_field filters must be used. These filters can be used if there is additional custom encoding besides the ones already handled by WPML.

custom_field_val.label: custom_field_val
custom_field_val.description: Value contained within field that needs to be encoded

custom_field_name.label: custom_field_name
custom_field_name.description: Name of the field that needs to be encoded

wpml_enqueue_browser_redirect_language.name: wpml_enqueue_browser_redirect_language
wpml_enqueue_browser_redirect_language.summary: Use a custom JavaScript for handling the browser redirection
wpml_enqueue_browser_redirect_language.description:
This filter is used when the theme developer wants to use a custom JavaScript for handling the browser redirection.

This filters a boolean set to true by default.
If the filter returns false, the JavaScript which takes care of redirecting the visitor won’t be enqueued.
The filter is applied only if the wpml_browser_redirect_language_params filter returns a valid $param (pageLanguage and languageUrls must be set).

wpml_get_cross_domain_language_data.name: wpml_get_cross_domain_language_data
wpml_get_cross_domain_language_data.summary: Retrieve the data passed among language domains.
wpml_get_cross_domain_language_data.description:
• Retrieve the data passed by the filter wpml_cross_domain_language_data.You can find more details in our document Passing session data between languages in domains.
  • This is specific for the language URL format Different languages in directories.

array.label: array
array.description: (array) (Required) This is just an empty array, you should always use this value array().

wpml_get_element_translations.name: wpml_get_element_translations
wpml_get_element_translations.summary: Get the element translations info using “trid” (the ID of the translation group)
wpml_get_element_translations.description:
• Get the element translations info using trid (the ID of the translation group).
  • trid can be retrieved by the wpml_element_trid filter.
  • Learn more about this on the WPML’s tables documentation page.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is usually the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list.

trid.label: trid
trid.description: (integer) (Required) The ID of the translation group.

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Optional) The type of an element. Can be a post type: post_post, post_page, post_attachment, post_nav_menu_item, post_{custom post key} or taxonomy: tax_category, tax_post_tag, tax_nav_menu, tax_{custom taxonomy key}. Defaults to post_post if not set.

wpml_get_translated_slug.name: wpml_get_translated_slug
wpml_get_translated_slug.summary: Get the post type slug translation in a specific language.
wpml_get_translated_slug.description:
• Gets the post type slug translation in a specific language.
  • The translation value is saved in WPML->Translation Management->Multilingual Content Setup->Custom posts.

slug.label: slug
slug.description: (string) (Required) The value is set in the rewrite argument of the register_post_type function.

post_type.label: post_type
post_type.description: (string) (Required) The first parameter value of the register_post_type function.

language_code.label: language_code
language_code.description: (string) (Optional) Return the translation in this language. Default is NULL which returns the current language.

wpml_hide_management_column.name: wpml_hide_management_column
wpml_hide_management_column.summary: Allow hiding the translation management column based on post types.
wpml_hide_management_column.description:
• Allows hiding the translation management column based on the post type.
  • This filter is working in sync with Screen Options. Therefore, hiding column from Screen Options will have the same effect.

is_visible.label: is_visible
is_visible.description: (bool) Whether or not the translation management column displays.

wpml_home_url.name: wpml_home_url
wpml_home_url.summary: Get a site's home url for the current language
wpml_home_url.description:
Returns the home url in the current language. To be used in place of get_option('home')

* Note: Good code will make use of get_home_url() or home_url() which apply filters natively. In this case there is no need to replace anything.

wpml_is_redirected.name: wpml_is_redirected
wpml_is_redirected.description: WPML automatically tries to redirect visitors to the canonical URL when it does find a match. This hook allows to disable this WPML functionality.

redirect.label: redirect
redirect.description: (bool) Boolean value to define whether or not to disable WPML canonical URL redirection actions.

wpml_is_rtl.name: wpml_is_rtl
wpml_is_rtl.summary: Find out whether the current language text direction is RTL or not
wpml_is_rtl.description: Returns TRUE is the current language is RTL

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

wpml_language_form_input_field.name: wpml_language_form_input_field
wpml_language_form_input_field.summary: Filter the hidden input field rendered by the wpml_add_language_form_field hook.
wpml_language_form_input_field.description: Filter the hidden input field rendered by the wpml_add_language_form_field hook.

function_to_add.label: function_to_add
function_to_add.description: (callable) (Required) Your callback to be run when the filter is applied.

wpml_language_is_active.name: wpml_language_is_active
wpml_language_is_active.summary: Find out if a specific language is enabled for the site
wpml_language_is_active.description: Returns TRUE or FALSE if a given language has been enabled.

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

language_code.label: language_code
language_code.description: (string) (Required) The language code to check. Accepts a 2-letter code like ‘en’

wpml_ls_directories_to_scan.name: wpml_ls_directories_to_scan
wpml_ls_directories_to_scan.summary: Add directories containing language switcher templates
wpml_ls_directories_to_scan.description:
• Add directories containing language switcher templates.
  • This hook is useful when developers want to add their own directories instead of the default directory {your-theme-folder}/wpml/templates/language-switchers/.
  • See more at the Designing Custom Language Switchers Using Template Files document.

wpml_ls_model_css_classes.name: wpml_ls_model_css_classes
wpml_ls_model_css_classes.summary: Filter CSS classes for language switcher wrappers. These wrappers are not available for language switchers in menus.
wpml_ls_model_css_classes.description: Filter CSS classes for language switcher wrappers. These wrappers are not available for language switchers in menus.

css_classes.label: css_classes
css_classes.description: (array) The array including CSS classes for language switcher wrappers.

wpml_ls_model_language_css_classes.name: wpml_ls_model_language_css_classes
wpml_ls_model_language_css_classes.summary: Filter CSS classes for each item in a language switcher
wpml_ls_model_language_css_classes.description: Filter CSS classes for each item in a language switcher.

css_classes.label: css_classes
css_classes.description: (array) The array including CSS classes for each item of language switchers.

wpml_master_post_from_duplicate.name: wpml_master_post_from_duplicate
wpml_master_post_from_duplicate.summary: Get the original post from its duplicated post
wpml_master_post_from_duplicate.description: Returns the original post ID from the duplicated post ID

wpml_object_id.name: wpml_object_id
wpml_object_id.summary: Get the ID in the current language or in another language you specify
wpml_object_id.description: Returns an element’s ID in the current language or in another specified language.

element_id.label: element_id
element_id.description: (int) (Required) The ID of the post type (post, page, attachment, custom post) or taxonomy term (tag, category, custom taxonomy) to filter

element_type.label: element_type
element_type.description: (string) (Required) The type of element the ID belongs to. Can be post, page, {custom post type key}, nav_menu, nav_menu_item, category, post_tag, {custom taxonomy key}

return_original_if_missing.label: return_original_if_missing
return_original_if_missing.description: (bool) (Optional) If set to true it will always return a value (the original value, if translation is missing) Default is FALSE

ulanguage_code.label: ulanguage_code
ulanguage_code.description: (mixed) (Optional) If missing or NULL, it will use the current language. If set to a language code, it will return a translation for that language code or the original if the translation is missing and $return_original_if_missing is set to TRUE. Default is NULL

wpml_permalink.name: wpml_permalink
wpml_permalink.summary: Add language information to WordPress permalinks
wpml_permalink.description:
Filters a WordPress permalink and converts it to a language-specific permalink based on the language URL format set in the WPML language settings.

This means that when “Language URL format” is set to “Different languages in directories” the permalink will be returned in the http://domain.com/de form. When “A different domain per language” is selected the permalink will be converted to include the correct domain assigned to the requested language.

permalink.label: permalink
permalink.description: (string) (Required) The WordPress generated URL to filter.

language_code.label: language_code
language_code.description: (string) (Optional) The language to convert the url into. It accepts a 2-letter code. When set to null, it falls back to default language for root page, or current language in all other cases. Default is null

full_resolution.label: full_resolution
full_resolution.description: (boolean) (Optional) Enable full conversion of hard-coded URLs.

wpml_post_duplicates.name: wpml_post_duplicates
wpml_post_duplicates.summary: Get the duplicated posts of another post you specify
wpml_post_duplicates.description: Returns the duplicated post IDs from the original post ID.

master_post_id.label: master_post_id
master_post_id.description: (int) (Required) The original post id from which duplicates exist

wpml_post_language_details.name: wpml_post_language_details
wpml_post_language_details.summary: Get the language of a post
wpml_post_language_details.description:
Retrieve language information of a post by its ID.

The language information that is returned includes:

  • the post language 2-letter code,
  • the post locale,
  • the language text direction (True for RTL, False for LTR),
  • the post language translated name and native name and
  • whether the current language is different to the post language (True/False)

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: (int) (Optional) The post id to retrieve information of (post, page, attachment, custom post) Defaults to current post ID.

wpml_setting.name: wpml_setting
wpml_setting.summary: Get the value of a WPML setting

default.label: default
default.description: (mixed|bool) (Required) The value to return if the settings key does not exist. Set to false if not using

key.label: key
key.description: (string) (Required) The settings name key to return the value of

wpml_sub_setting.name: wpml_sub_setting
wpml_sub_setting.summary: Get the value of a WPML sub setting
wpml_sub_setting.description:
Returns a WPML sub setting value.

Attention

  • This hook is temporarily broken in WPML 3.3.6. We are working on it to fix this issue.
  • Currently you can use this hook wpml_setting for the same purpose.
  • Example:
    // Example: I need to get sub setting "font-current-normal" of "icl_lang_sel_config"$switcher = apply_filters( 'wpml_setting', false, 'icl_lang_sel_config' );echo $switcher['font-current-normal'];

default.label: default
default.description: (mixed|bool) (Required) The value to return if the settings key does not exist. Set to false if not using

key.label: key
key.description: (string) (Required) The settings name key the sub key belongs to

sub_key.label: sub_key
sub_key.description: (string) (Required) The sub key to return the value of

wpml_tm_save_translation_cf.name: wpml_tm_save_translation_cf
wpml_tm_save_translation_cf.summary: Filter custom fields before saving in WPML's translation editor or XLIFF import
wpml_tm_save_translation_cf.description:
WPML applies this hook filter on custom field values when a translation is saved either via the translation editor screen or via an XLIFF import. The custom field value is in this way made available to external themes and plugins for further manipulation before saving e.g. encoding or substitution.

Note: This hook requires the WPML Translation Management module

data.label: data
data.description: (array) (Optional) The data array being processed through the filter

wpml_tm_xliff_export_original_cf.name: wpml_tm_xliff_export_original_cf
wpml_tm_xliff_export_original_cf.summary: Filter original custom field values before XLIFF export
wpml_tm_xliff_export_original_cf.description:
WPML applies this hook filter to the original custom field values when a document is exported to an XLIFF file. The custom field value is in this way made available to external themes and plugins for further manipulation before saving e.g. substitution.

Note: This hook requires the WPML Translation Management module

field_data.label: field_data
field_data.description: (string) (Optional) The encoded original custom field value.

wpml_tm_xliff_export_translated_cf.name: wpml_tm_xliff_export_translated_cf
wpml_tm_xliff_export_translated_cf.summary: Filter translated custom field values before XLIFF export
wpml_tm_xliff_export_translated_cf.description:
WPML applies this hook filter to the translated custom field values when a document is exported to an XLIFF file. The custom field value is in this way made available to external themes and plugins for further manipulation before saving e.g. substitution.

Note: This hook requires the WPML Translation Management module

field_data_translated.label: field_data_translated
field_data_translated.description: (string) (Optional) The encoded translated custom field value. Empty if not translated yet

wpml_translatable_user_meta_fields.name: wpml_translatable_user_meta_fields
wpml_translatable_user_meta_fields.summary: Make certain user meta fields translatable through WPML String Translation.
wpml_translatable_user_meta_fields.description: Filters an array of user meta keys which will be translated when calling the function get_the_author(). The translatable user meta fields will be registered as strings in WPML String Translation.

user_meta_fields.label: user_meta_fields
user_meta_fields.description: (array) (Required) Containing the user meta fields to translate.

wpml_translate_single_string.name: wpml_translate_single_string
wpml_translate_single_string.description:
*Retrieves an individual (as opposed to a string that is part of a package**) text string translation. The filter looks for a string with matching $domain and $name. If it finds it, it looks for a translation in the current language or the language you specify. If a translation exists, it will return it. Otherwise, it will return the original string.

*To register a string for translation please see: wpml_register_single_string
**For retrieving a string translation that is part of a package please see: wpml_translate_string

Note: This hook requires the WPML String Translation module

language_code.label: language_code
language_code.description: (string) (Optional) Return the translation in this language. Default is NULL which returns the current language

wpml_translate_string.name: wpml_translate_string
wpml_translate_string.description:
*Retrieves a string translation. The filter looks up a string that is part of a package or a group of strings (as opposed to an individual string**). If it finds it, it looks for a translation in the current language. If a translation exists, it will return it. Otherwise, it will return the original string.

*To register a “package” string translation please see: wpml_register_string
**For retrieving an individual text string that does not belong to a package please see: wpml_translate_single_string

Note: This hook requires the WPML String Translation module

\n\nIf $package is an array it needs to.label:
If $package is an array it needs to be associative and contain keys kind and name.
If $package is an object it needs to have kind and name fields.

wpml_translated_language_name.name: wpml_translated_language_name
wpml_translated_language_name.summary: Get a language's translated name in another language which you specify
wpml_translated_language_name.description:
Returns the translated name of a language in another specified language.

*Note: The languages involved do not need to be active for the site

empty_value.label: empty_value
empty_value.description: (mixed) (Required) This is normally the value the filter will be modifying. We are not filtering anything here so set this to NULL. This for the filter function to actually receive the full argument list

lang_code.label: lang_code
lang_code.description: (string) (Required) The language name will be for this language. Accepts a 2-letter code e.g. en

display_code.label: display_code
display_code.description: (string|bool) (Optional) The language name will display translated in this language. Accepts a 2-letter code e.g. de. If set to false it will return the translated name in the current language. Default is FALSE.

wpml_unfiltered_admin_string.name: wpml_unfiltered_admin_string
wpml_unfiltered_admin_string.summary: Retrieve an option value by-passing WPML ST filters.
wpml_unfiltered_admin_string.description:
WPML String Translation filters theme/plugin setting options in order to return translations of their values in the current language.
This means that on a WordPress installation with WPML languages set for example to English as primary and German as secondary language, you can expect the German translations to be the values retrieved when calling:get_option('{theme_name}_settings'); while the current language is German. Then while the current language is English, the English values will be displayed.

This also means however, that when an option value is updated with: update_option('{theme_name}_settings', $new_value); the option value will be updated in both languages. This may not be always desirable.

This is where the above filter is helpful. The filter allows retrieving an option value by-passing WPML String Translation filters. What is returned is the value in the language it is retrieved in so that further operations taken such as updating it the value in the database will not affect languages other than the one you are working with.

default_value.label: default_value
default_value.description: (mixed) (Required) The value to return in case the string does not exist

option_name.label: option_name
option_name.description: (string) (Optional) The name of the option to retrieve. A non SQL-escaped name is expected.
